data.meta_description: Nick Nolte (48 Hrs.), Julie Christie (Heaven Can Wait), Lara Flynn Boyle (Happiness) and Jonny Lee Miller (Trainspotting) star in director Alan Rudolph's (Mortal Thoughts) wry romance about a handyman who wreaks havoc and builds romance in two marriages. Desperate to have a baby, Marianne hires Lucky Mann to remodel a nursery. There's just one problem: Marianne's not pregnant and her husband isn't interested in sex. So what's a handyman to do? Intimate, intelligent, reckless and romantic, you'll delight in this one and you'll leave in an 'AFTERGLOW' of pleasure! Gene Shalit, Today, NBC-TV
data.text:
Nick Nolte (48 Hrs.), Julie Christie (Heaven Can Wait), Lara Flynn Boyle (Happiness) and Jonny Lee Miller (Trainspotting) star in director Alan Rudolph's (Mortal Thoughts) wry romance about a handyman who wreaks havoc and builds romance in two marriages. Desperate to have a baby, Marianne hires Lucky Mann to remodel a nursery. There's just one problem: Marianne's not pregnant and her husband isn't interested in sex. So what's a handyman to do? Intimate, intelligent, reckless and romantic, "you'll delight in this one and you'll leave in an 'AFTERGLOW' of pleasure!" Gene Shalit, Today, NBC-TV

Media

Watch trailer »

Sales Points

Afterglow all star cast includes: Nick Nolte (48 Hrs.), Julie Christie (Heaven Can Wait), Lara Flynn Boyle (Happiness) and Jonny Lee Miller (Trainspotting).

Afterglow hails from producer Robert Altman (Gosford Park, Short Cuts, M*A*S*H*, The Player)

WINNER – BEST ACTRESS: JULIE CHRISTIE, New York Film Critics Circle & National Society of Film Critics

From Award Winning Writer / Director Alan Ruldolph (Mrs. Parker and the Vicious Circle, Mortal Thoughts)

1997 ACADEMY AWARD NOMINEE: BEST ACTRESS – Julie Christie

Press Quotes

Nolte is magnificent. Christie has never looked more beautiful.

—Dennis Dermody, PAPER

Offbeat, original and entertaining... a truly novel film.

—VARIETY

This double feature of Alan Rudolph films features some really winning performances. Technical merits are generally solid for those considering a purchase.

—Blu-ray.com
